title: 108_s683
content: The "Military Families Leave Act of 2003" is the short title of this Act. It outlines general requirements for leave. The "Military Families Leave Act of 2003" provides entitlement to leave for eligible employees for up to 12 workweeks in a 12-month period due to a family member's active duty in the Armed Forces. An eligible employee can take leave while their family member is on active duty in support of a contingency operation, only for issues related to the family member's service in that operation. An eligible employee can take up to 12 workweeks of leave for issues related to their family member's service in a contingency operation. The amendment allows for intermittent or reduced leave schedules under subsection (a)(3) of the Act. Employers can request certification for leave related to a family member's active duty. Notice must be provided to the employer for leave under subsection (a)(3). An employer may require certification for leave under section 102(a)(3) as prescribed by the Secretary. SEC. 3. LEAVE FOR CIVIL SERVICE EMPLOYEES. Entitlement to Leave: An eligible employee can take up to 12 workweeks of leave in a 12-month period if their family member is on active duty in support of a contingency operation. This includes family members who are notified of an impending call to active duty. An eligible employee can take up to 12 workweeks of leave in a 12-month period if their family member is on active duty in support of a contingency operation. This leave is only for issues related to the family member's service on active duty, including notification of impending call or order to active duty. No employee can take more than 12 workweeks of leave in any 12-month period. Section 6382 of the title is amended to allow intermittent or reduced leave schedules for leave under subsection (a)(3). Employing agencies may require certification for leave under section 6382(a)(3) and employees must provide notice as practicable. The Office of Personnel Management may regulate the time and manner for leave under section 6382(a)(3).
